name: Nimbla
slogan: Nimbla enables small business trade with confidence
description: Nimbla is a digital insurance platform designed to protect small and medium-sized businesses against insolvent and late paying customers. With Nimbla’s first of-a-kind technology, businesses can check a buyer’s ability to pay and then insure individual invoices against non-payment in a fast and affordable way. We’re Nimbla, and we’re just getting started.

jobs.title: Chief Technical Officer (CTO)
jobs.description:
Nimbla provides a first of a kind invoice protection solution so that Britain’s SMEs continue to trade with confidence. We're building the future of small business protection and are on a high growth trajectory. We're a Barclays Techstars accelerator alumni and we have the backing from a world-leading insurance company.

The Chief Technology Officer will be someone who wants the freedom to build something different and help us keep the thriving small business enterprise alive. This is the opportunity to help shape the direction of one of the most promising FinTech startups in the UK. We will count on you to make a significant contribution to our success and will support yours in the process.

About you
You're a highly innovative leader driven to build the strategic technical roadmap of Nimbla and the parent company TradeCrediTech. Passionate about supporting a growing business, you're looking for the opportunity to use your technical acumen to shape the vision and the future of the organisation. You excel in an open environment where you have the flexibility to work in a way that suits you best. With a passion for high-quality innovative solutions, you will be experienced in leading from the front lines. You see your team's success as your number one priority and will provide them with the mentorship and support to create a thriving organisation.

You will
Establish the company’s strategic technical vision and transform the Nimbla platform into a reliable, secure and scalable product
Leads all aspects of the company’s technological development and be responsible for the delivery of all software, including product roadmap velocity and quality, and own the product roadmap
Mentor, coach, engage and motivate the current team (2 Senior Developers, 2 Junior Developers, 2 Product) as well as lead the recruitment effort for the technical team
Lead and develop people across the organisation, so together we can achieve the company's vision by supporting the creation of an environment where people are given the best opportunity to thrive
Be an enthusiastic leader who enjoys leading from the front and working across teams, actively seeking to develop your leadership skills
Manage day to day tech operations: project management, application architecture, bug triage, QA & testing, DevOps
Communicate the progress of the Product, Engineering and Design domain to the company, the board and the investors
Creating timelines for the development and deployment of all technological services
Maintaining a consumer-centric outlook when designing and delivering the Nimbla platform
Ensuring all technology practices adhere to compliance and regulatory standards
Support and develop a growth mindset across the domain, be the driver for change and growth at a business and a personal development
Identify competitive advantages and technological trends for the benefit of a company
Directs the development and possible implementation of policies in instances of a breach, including disaster recovery plans
Your experience
A front-line leader who sees your team's success as your own, providing mentorship and support to help people grow
Are comfortable as a leader and want to continue to develop your leadership skills, you enjoy leading from the front and working across teams
See individual team members’ success as the number one priority
Able to communicate clearly, organise effectively and delegate responsibility so problems are solved quickly
A strong sense of purpose and be able to develop profitable strategies, implementing the vision set for the organisation
BS in or extensive technological skill set and  a demonstrated history with Information Technology and proven experience in the arena, within a strategic leadership role
Ability to actively communicate, inspire and motivate all levels, both internally and externally
Ability to think and act strategically and proactively
Knowledge of technology trends and of conducting technological analyses and research to build the organisation's technical strategy
Experience of working within a regulated industry
Bonus points for
Knowledge of FinTech or InsurTech
What we believe in
Fairness
For our customers because we aim to make business a fairer place by protecting small and medium-sized businesses from bad debt. For our team because together, we create an environment in which everyone is comfortable developing within their roles and within the business.

Learning
Aim to learn something new every day, big or small to grow personally and bring about positive change.

Creativity
We each strive to be creative, support innovation and wonderful experiences to our users.
‍
Measuring performance by more than time
Work smarter rather than harder and measure results rather than time.
‍
Flexible working
Once you are familiar with our objectives and the way we work. We are based in a comfortable and trendy workspace, a stone’s throw from the city. We would love to see you there but you will also have the opportunity to work remotely.

What you'd expect
A competitive salary
Share options
£1000 training budget per year, to spend as you wish
We offer 28 days of annual leave per year, plus bank holidays and your birthday off
Full auto-enrolment workplace pension for all employees with 3% employer contribution
Comfortable and trendy Whitechapel/Aldgate workspace
Unlimited coffee and tea
Cycle to work scheme
Tech purchase scheme
Discounts on cinema tickets, train tickets, etc.
What's more
Autonomy and empowerment
‍What matters is that the job gets done and that we help each other in accomplishing our vision and goals. Once the goals are set, how you achieve results is up to you.

‍Radical candour
We all want to grow and we help each other do so by maintaining candid, open conversations, especially when it’s hard. Be kind, and be open and honest.

‍Dynamic working hours
We trust you to establish an effective working pattern that allows you to excel in your role. This includes working from home, of course.

‍Dog friendly
‍Our furry friend Oscar is in the office sometimes.
